subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: No. 5 Florida has reinstated defensive end Carlos Dunlap, and Coach Urban Meyer said on Friday that Dunlap would play in the Sugar Bowl on Jan. 1 against No. 4 Cincinnati. Dunlap was arrested Dec. 1, days before the Southeastern Conference title game, and charged with driving under the influence. Dunlap has a court appearance Jan. 10. Nonetheless, Meyer said he talked with Bernie Machen, Florida’s president, and Athletic Director Jeremy Foley, and they agreed to let Dunlap back on the team. ¶Tennessee addressed one of its recruiting investigations, announcing that Coach Lane Kiffin and his staff would not be allowed to take interns on recruiting trips next year. The self-imposed penalty is not part of the N.C.A.A.’s investigation of the university’s Orange Pride student ambassador group. The athletic department said the Southeastern Conference agreed with the university’s action regarding interns after an internal review into the Volunteers’ recruiting practices. vols.
